_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention And Emergency Response Policies

Country Fresh, LLC has made a strong commitment to improve the facility chemical safety program from the original RMP submission in 1999.  These improvements have included more awareness of chemical hazards, system upgrades, staffing additions, and constant review and maintenance of the RMP and Process Safety Manament programs.

Facility And Regulated Substance Handling

Country Fresh, LLC is a producer of dairy products which includes the processing, packaging, and delivery of milk, cottage cheese, bottled water, and various types of dips.  We also produce bagged ice.  The facility also has a large freezer and several coolers used as central storage and distribution point for ice cream and yogurt.  The entire facility is located within a seventeen acre site which is comprised of manufacturing, distribution, garage, and offices.

Accidental Release Orevention Program And Chemical Specific Prevention

Country Fresh, LLC complies with the State of Michigan MIOSHA regulations which include Process Safety Management (PSM).  Additionally the facility complies with federal EPA and State of Michigan Department of Environmental Quality (DEQ) standards.

Our program of chemical safety includes:

- Technological improvements - upgrading of the ammonia system,
- Management systems which result in improved maintenance using Preventative Maintenance, and
- Upgrading of procedures and training programs.

Five Year Accident History

In the last five years, country Fresh, LLC has no accidental releases meeting the reporting criteria.

Emergency Response Program

Our emergency response program includes coordination of efforts through the Kent County LEPC and Wyoming Fire Department.  Additionally, specified individuals within the plant have completed emergency response training so they may act as "specialists" in the event of ammonia releases.  These individuals receive 8 hour annual refresher training.  The facility als

o works closely with the local fire department regarding proper chemical release notifications and coordination between all parties.  In the event of an emergency, public notification would be through the local fire department.

Changes For Improved Safety

Our programs have and will continue to improve.  In early 2003 we acquired a full time degreed Environmental, Health & Safety Manager.  This individual has strengthened our written policies and procedures and coordination with outside response agencies.  Additionally, in 2003 we acquired an engineer with full-time responsibility for upgrading and maintaining our Process Safety Management Program.
